ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Neurofibromatosis (NF2)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed by MRI findings of bilateral Cerebellopontine Angle (CPA) lesions.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right Acoustic Tumor (Vestibular Schwannoma)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: MRI shows probable acoustic tumor on the right with extension into the Internal Auditory Meatus (IAM), consistent with progressive high-frequency SNHL and ABR findings.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left Meningioma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: MRI shows probable meningioma on the left; ABR suggests brainstem compression rather than direct nerve involvement.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity given complaints of hearing loss and tinnitus.
To assess neural integrity given asymmetric symptoms and tinnitus.
To visualize retrocochlear structures due to abnormal ABR and asymmetric auditory findings.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic evaluation revealed normal hearing in the left ear but progressive high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear. Speech recognition was excellent bilaterally. ABR was abnormal bilaterally, showing retrocochlear signs on the right (consistent with IAM involvement) and signs of brainstem compression on the left. MRI confirmed bilateral CPA masses, leading to a diagnosis of Neurofibromatosis.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Normal hearing sensitivity (0-10 dB HL). Right ear: Moderate to severe high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, sloping to ~65 dB HL at 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Excellent speech recognition scores bilaterally (RE 96%, LE 100%).

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Abnormal bilaterally. Right ear: Extended I-V interval (5.64 ms) and missing Wave III. Left ear: Extended Wave V latency, normal I-III, but abnormal III-V (2.77 ms) and I-V (4.87 ms) intervals.

tests.name: MRI
tests.result_summary: Bilateral CPA mass lesions. Right side: Probable acoustic tumor extending into the Internal Auditory Meatus. Left side: Probable meningioma.

counseling_actions: Discuss MRI findings indicating bilateral CPA masses
Correlate right-sided hearing loss with tumor extension into the Internal Auditory Meatus
Explain left-sided ABR abnormalities as likely due to brainstem compression by the meningioma

escalation.rationale_short: Presence of bilateral CPA tumors (Neurofibromatosis) requiring surgical evaluation.
